title: See tweets by White House calling out Republican lawmakers
description: The White House offered a pointed defense of its student loan cancellation plan on Twitter, calling out Republican lawmakers who have had Paycheck Protection Program loans forgiven. CNN's MJ Lee has more on the tweets and the President's response.

title: 'I can't hold on much longer': Father and son rescued after boat sinks
description: Boston police rescued a father and son from the chilly waters of Boston Harbor after their boat struck rocks and sank. CNN affiliate WCVB has the story

title: Key takeaways from the Mar-a-Lago search warrant affidavit
Affidavit reveals FBI told a judge that a search would likely find 'evidence of obstruction'
description: The FBI told a judge that there was "probable cause to believe" that classified national security materials were improperly taken to "unauthorized" locations at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort, and that a search would also likely find "evidence of obstruction," according to a redacted version of the search warrant affidavit released Friday.

title: 21 ​​'filtration​​​' sites found in Russian-held ​​territory: researchers
description: Researchers at Yale University ​say they have uncovered 21 "​filtration" sites in the Russian-controlled territory of Donetsk ​in eastern Ukraine.

title: Screening dog at Minneapolis-St. Paul Airport wins TSA's 'Cutest Canine Contest'
description: Dog lovers -- get ready for your hearts to melt over a hard-working dog named Eebbers.

title: Pilots from bankrupt airline offered jobs with no interview by competitor
description: Pilots are in high demand lately -- such high demand, in fact, that pilots from the recently defunct ExpressJet Airlines are finding themselves with new job offers, without so much as an interview, days after their employer declared bankruptcy.

title: See what stood out to CNN reporter about redacted affidavit
description: A redacted version of the Mar-a-Lago search warrant affidavit has been unsealed by the Justice Department, as ordered by a federal judge. Jessica Schneider gives the details on CNN Inside Politics.

title: What we learned from Mark Zuckerberg's 3-hour chat with Joe Rogan
description: In a rare and lengthy interview, Mark Zuckerberg spoke with controversial comedian and podcast host Joe Rogan about Meta's plans to release a new virtual-reality headset, his newfound love of jiu-jitsu and his company's decision to limit the reach of an article about Hunter Biden that came out in the final weeks leading up to the 2020 election.

title: Drought reveals marvels around the world
description: Dinosaur tracks, World War II warships, and prehistoric rock formations. See what the global drought has revealed as water levels continue to drop in many parts of the world.

title: Christie's to sell Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen's $1 billion art collection
description: The personal art collection of the late Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen could raise more than $1 billion when it goes under the hammer in November, in what is being billed as the largest auction sale in history.

title: It's OK to kill this beautiful but invasive insect, experts say
description: State agricultural departments across the United States are asking you to commit murder -- bug murder, that is.

title: Moderna sues Pfizer and BioNTech over mRNA patents
description: Moderna on Friday filed patent infringement lawsuits against Pfizer and BioNTech "for infringing patents central to (its) mRNA technology platform," the company said in a news release Friday.

title: Fed chairman Jerome Powell says Fed's fight to tame inflation is 'unconditional'
Princess Diana's one-of-a-kind Ford Escort goes up for auction
description: A unique black Ford Escort driven by the late Princess Diana in the 1980s is due to be auctioned this weekend at Britain's Silverstone racing circuit.

title: China's worst heat wave on record is crippling power supplies. How it reacts will impact us all
Must-watch videos of the week
Solomon Islands ghosted a US ship, official says, stoking fears of China's influence
After a dark turn, Shia LaBeouf finds new faith
description: Shia LaBeouf says that he has discovered Catholicism after a dark period in his life.

title: Russia is burning off millions of dollars in gas every day. Here's why
description: Russia is burning an estimated $10 million worth of natural gas a day near its border with Finland, analysts say, even as it threatens to push Europe into a winter energy crisis by restricting exports to Germany and other countries.

title: What managers should know about 'quiet quitting'
description: The now viral phrase "quiet quitting" is annoyingly imprecise and misleading.

title: Forty years on, Hezbollah is isolated but more powerful than ever
description: Hezbollah capped off the 40th anniversary of its founding on Monday with large-scale celebrations on a stage in southern Beirut that featured holograms of fighters killed in battle, and videos showing off the group's historic confrontation with Israel. An interpretive dance, depicting how the group freed prisoners from ISIS in Syria, was a notable addition.

title: China and US sign deal that could avert mass stock delistings
description: The US audit regulator said on Friday it has signed an agreement with Chinese regulators, taking a first step toward inspecting and investigating registered accounting firms in China and Hong Kong.

title: Doggie dementia risk rises each year after age 10, study finds. Here's what to look for
description: Just like people, dogs can get dementia as they age. The spry speedster that used to zoom out the door may one day amble unsteadily to the closet to be let out.

title: Pakistan floods hit 33 million people in worst disaster in a decade, minister says
description: At least 33 million people have been affected by deadly flooding in Pakistan, the country's climate change minister said on Thursday.

title: EPA wants to label certain 'forever chemicals' as hazardous substances
description: The US Environmental Protection Agency announced Friday that it proposes to label certain "forever chemicals" that are found in hundreds of household items and pollute drinking water systems across the country as hazardous substances.

title: 'Old school meets new school' at Barcelona as Xavi and Pep Guardiola face off as managers
description: It felt almost like a family reunion at Barcelona's Camp Nou as Xavi Hernández and Pep Guardiola faced each other for the first time as managers this week.

title: Her slaying went unsolved for 34 years. Police say they identified her killer after he licked an envelope
description: After more than three decades of questions and grief, Tamika Reyes finally knows who killed her mother.

title: Prince Harry shares his hopes for 25th anniversary of Princess Diana's death
description: Prince Harry has shared his hopes for the upcoming 25th anniversary of the death of his mother, Diana, Princess of Wales.

title: Britney Spears teams up with Elton John on 'Hold Me Closer,' her first release in six years
description: The Princess of Pop is back!

title: Dangerous heat waves to at least triple across the world by 2100, study says
description: The dangerous levels of heat that have scorched swathes of the northern hemisphere this summer are likely to hit most of the world between three and 10 times more often by the turn of the century, as the impacts of the human-caused climate crisis accelerate, a new study has found.

title: Meet Commander Moonikin Campos, the mannequin going farther than any astronaut
description: Artemis I will carry an unconventional crew when it's expected to lift off Monday on a journey around the moon.

title: US Open: Why is it so difficult to win a second grand slam?
description: When Emma Raducanu won the US Open last year, she dropped her racket, sank to the floor and covered her face in her hands.

title: Iranian women allowed to attend domestic football match for first time in over 40 years
description: Hundreds of Iranian women attended a professional domestic football match in Tehran for the first time in over 40 years, following a ban on women attending sports stadiums.

title: Zoo employee stages escape in ostrich costume
description: With its long neck, round torso, tail feathers and lumbering gait, the huge creature being chased around a Thai zoo by net-wielding veterinarians appears to be an ostrich.

title: How China's record heat wave will affect the whole world
UK household energy bills to soar by 80% in October
description: British energy bills will rise 80% to an average of £3,549 ($4,188) a year from October, regulator Ofgem said on Friday, calling it a "crisis" that needed to be tackled by urgent and decisive government action.

title: Solomon Islands ghosted a US ship
description: A United States Coast Guard vessel was unable to enter Solomon Islands for a routine port call because the Solomon Islands government did not respond to a request for it to refuel and provision, a US official said.

title: Sleep, talk about coffee, wake up, talk about coffee: Papua New Guinea has a brand new minister job
description: The leader of Papua New Guinea has appointed what are believed to be the world's first ministers for coffee and palm oil.

title: 'A lot like Hillary Clinton': Conservative reacts to Biden slamming MAGA republicans
description: CNN's Scott Jennings and Democratic strategist Maria Cardona debate President Joe Biden's speech where he called out MAGA republicans and comments he made saying the their philosophy was "semi-fascist."

title: Looking back on 50 years of the Hard Rock Cafe
description: Before it was a global chain and internationally-recognized brand, the Hard Rock Cafe was a single restaurant in London.

title: From Brad Pitt to Lil Nas X, more men are turning to skirts
description: When Brad Pitt arrived at the premiere for new movie "Bullet Train" last month, his laidback linen outfit made headlines everywhere -- or part of it did, at least. The actor, who is known for hypermasculine roles in films such as "Fight Club" and "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood," completed his blush pink-and-brown ensemble with an eye-catching twist: a skirt.

title: How these migrants are faring 1 week after Texas paid to bus them out of state
description: CNN's Gary Tuchman catches up with migrants Texas Gov. Greg Abbott sent by bus from his state to cities across the US in an effort to highlight his criticism of the Biden administration's immigration policies.

title: Oscar Mayer introduces a hot dog-flavored ice pop
description: Hold the mustard ... hot dog-flavored ice pop really does taste like a wiener. CNN's Jeanne Moos chows down.

title: Nuclear plant is stopping Ukraine's advance. Retired Colonel explains why
description: Retired Air Force Col. Cedric Leighton says the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant held by Russia is essentially stopping Ukraine's advance in the southern part of the country.
